articles.title: 4 Things Schools Need To Consider When Designing AI Policies
articles.author: Sarah Hernholm
articles.summary: Pew Research Center study reveals that 26% of American teenagers now use AI tools for schoolwork. Many schools are rushing to establish AI policies. They focus too much on what students can't do and not enough on what teachers can do. They need to balance academic integrity and practical preparation for an AI-driven future. They also need to include students in AI policy development.

articles.title: Combining AI and agriculture; new $30 million AI building is coming to Tampa Bay
articles.author: Matt Lackritz
articles.summary: The University of Florida is building a new $30 million building dedicated to AI and agriculture in Wimauma, Florida. Professor Nathan Boyd said the new building will provide more resources for their work. He said AI is pivotal in growing crops because it allows people to detect things they couldn't in the past.

articles.title: Almost half of consumers say they have suffered poor service over the last year
articles.author: Josie Clarke
articles.summary: One in six consumers believe customer service standards have declined in the last year. Poor product quality and call centre experiences are the UK's biggest customer service bugbears. Consumers value timely responses to queries, being able to speak to a human rather than a chatbot and getting products or services on time.

articles.title: PageUp Infuses AI Across its Hiring Platform to Automate Repetitive Tasks and Accelerate Smart Hiring
articles.author: Page Up
articles.summary: PageUp, a global leader in talent acquisition software, announces the launch of advanced AI features across its recruitment marketing platform, PageUp Clinch, and its Applicant Tracking System. PageUp's mid-year product release is designed to solve the biggest challenges in today's hiring market: overwhelming application volumes and the need for speed without sacrificing personal touch.

articles.title: Salesforce (CRM) Price Target Cut to $325 — But Stifel Stays Bullish
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Parker Lane, an analyst at Stifel, has lowered the price target on the stock to $325.00 (from $375.00) while maintaining a Buy rating. The firm believes that Salesforce would have to show improved quarter-over-quarter performance in core and a solid uptick in Data plus AI contributions from the $1 billion level seen last quarter to drive multiple appreciation.

articles.title: Dell (DELL) Stock: Price Target Raised, But Headwinds Still Loom
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Susquehanna raised the firm's price target on Dell Technologies Inc. to $120 from $105 and kept a Neutral rating on the shares. Dell Technologies provides IT solutions, including servers, storage, networking, and personal computing devices to businesses and consumers worldwide.

articles.title: Don't Let AI Be Your Career Coach
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: It boggles the mind that so many people have flirted with or worse, committed to AI as a source of career coaching and it boggles my mind that many of them are not interested in AI as an alternative career option at all. It boggles me.

articles.title: AI Won't Replace Historians
articles.author: Wall Street Journal
articles.summary: A chatbot summarises existing knowledge. New knowledge requires the spark of human creativity to be added to the existing knowledge and it needs to be created by the user.      Â   in this case, the user needs to create the new knowledge.

articles.title: Piper Sandler Raises NVIDIA (NVDA) Price Target to $225 Ahead of Earnings
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Piper Sandler raised the price target on the stock of NVIDIA Corporation to $225.00 and maintained an Overweight rating. Nvidia specializes in AI-driven solutions, offering platforms for data centers, self-driving cars, robotics, and cloud services.

articles.title: Thread by @HeyGurisaroy on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Google Gemini has a new feature "Guided Learning" - an AI tutor that teaches you step-by-step. It's great for studying for exams, starting a new job, learning a new language or explaining a report to someone who's new. Pro tips: Use @OpenStax for help like a textbook.

articles.title: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Is The Largest Position In My Trust, Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) shares have lost 1% since the firm's latest earnings report. Jim Cramer believes Amazon's growth slowdown is due to over-reliance on its custom Trainium AI chips. Cramer also talked about Amazon's retail business.

articles.title: Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR) Could Help With Government Functioning, Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer recently discussed. The stock has gained 135% year-to-date. It currently trades at a 589 P/E ratio, which makes it highly valued.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD) Is Good But The Stock Shouldn't Have Risen Recently, Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMD)'s shares have gained 47% year-to-date as Wall Street remains bullish on the long-term prospects of AI and AMD's ability to cater to the demand. Jim Cramer wants to buy some of AMD's AI accelerators.

articles.title: Wells Fargo Says DELL Has ‘More Room to Run' as AI Server Leader
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Dell Technologies Inc. (NYSE:DELL) is one of the AI Stocks Investors Are Watching Right Now. On August 13, Wells Fargo reiterated the stock as 'Overweight'. Dell provides IT solutions, including servers, storage, networking, and personal computing devices to businesses and consumers worldwide.

articles.title: Ulta Beauty, Inc. (ULTA): I Thought The Target Partnership Ending Was Very Significant
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Ulta Beauty, Inc. (NASDAQ:ULTA) is a specialty beauty retailer whose shares have gained 21% year-to-date. Its shares jumped by 15% in May after the firm's first-quarter revenue and earnings beat analyst estimates. The shares dipped by 1% in August after Ulta Beauty announced it was ending its partnership with Target.

articles.title: Target Corporation (TGT): I Thought The Ulta Beauty Partnership Ending Was Very Significant
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Target Corporation (NYSE:TGT) is one of the largest retailers in America. Its shares have lost 24% year-to-date. Jim Cramer believes the firm needs to reduce prices to increase foot traffic in its stores. Cramer prefers Costco and TJX instead.

articles.title: Chinese scientist develops robot with artificial womb for human pregnancy
articles.author: Jillian  Delaney
articles.summary: A scientist based out of China is working on a robot that can carry a human fetus to term and give birth. The prototype is expected to debut some time next year. It will cost nearly 100,000 yuan, or about $14,000. A human surrogate can cost between $100,000 and $200,000 in the United States.

articles.title: The Sherwin-Williams Company (SHW): I Like It, But You've Got To Be Careful, Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: The Sherwin-Williams Company (NYSE:SHW) is a paint and chemicals company whose shares have struggled in tandem with the broader sector's woes. However, the shares might have been in the red this year had it not been for a 10% increase since July end. Jim Cramer linked the share price performance to the home renovation market.

articles.title: BigBear.ai (BBAI) Partners with DEFCON AI to Deliver Next-Gen Military Decision Intelligence Solutions
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: BigBear.ai (NYSE:BBAI) announced a new partnership with DEFCON AI to co-develop next-generation decision intelligence solutions for the U.S. military. The collaboration focuses on advancing logistics and operational readiness, particularly in contested or high-risk environments.

articles.title: Oppenheimer Downgrades C3.ai (AI) Amid Weak Results and Leadership Change
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE:AI) has been downgraded from Outperform to Perform by Oppenheimer analyst Timothy Horan on August 13th. The downgrade comes amid the company's weaker-than-expected preliminary results for the first quarter of fiscal 2026. CEO and founder Tom Siebel is stepping down due to health issues.

articles.title: SoundHound (SOUN) Upgraded to ‘Buy' by Ladenburg After Strong Q2 and Amelia Acquisition
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: SoundHound AI (NASDAQ:SOUN) is one of the best midcap AI stocks to buy right now. Ladenburg Thalmann upgraded SoundHound from Neutral to Buy and raised its price target from $9 to $16. The upgrade followed strong Q2 results and renewed confidence in the company's long-term trajectory. The firm pointed to improving revenue visibility, expanding deal flow and increased demand for AI-native solutions as tailwinds going forward.

articles.title: Needham Reaffirms Hold on C3.ai (AI) as Preliminary Results Signal 33% Revenue Decline
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: C3.ai (NYSE:AI) is one of the best midcap AI stocks to buy right now. Needham & Company reaffirmed its Hold rating on C3.AI following the company's preliminary Q1 results, which fell short of expectations. The analyst highlighted multiple headwinds, including a still-ongoing sales restructuring and CEO Tom Siebel's recent health issues, which made the investment case less clear in the short term.

articles.title: Wells Fargo Upgrades Varonis (VRNS) to Overweight, Citing Rising Demand for AI-Powered Data Protection
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: Varonis Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRNS) is one of the best midcap AI stocks to buy right now. On August 11, 2025, Wells Fargo upgraded Varonis from Equal Weight to Overweight and raised its price target from $51 to $70. Wells Fargo expects revenue to climb to $806 million in 2026 and reach $968 million by 2027.

articles.title: The ‘Godfather of AI‘ Reveals the Only Way Humanity Can Survive Superintelligent AI
articles.author: The Publisher
articles.summary: Professor Geoffrey Hinton is a Nobel Prize-winning researcher and professor of AI at the University of Toronto. He believes that humanity will be replaced by a superintelligent AI in the next 20 to 25 years. Professor Hinton believes we need to program AI to have maternal instincts towards humanity. He points to evolution for inspiration.

articles.title: Criminals, good guys and foreign spies: Hackers everywhere are using AI now
articles.author: NBC Boston
articles.summary: This summer, Russia's hackers sent phishing emails to Ukrainians with an artificial intelligence program that would search the victims' computers for sensitive files to send back to Moscow. That campaign was detailed in technical reports from the Ukrainian government and several cybersecurity companies. It is the first known instance of Russi…

articles.title: UiPath (PATH) Launches Generative Extractions to Automate Complex Document Processing
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: UiPath Inc. (NYSE:PATH) is one of the best midcap AI stocks to buy right now. On August 1, 2025, UiPath announced the general availability of its new Generative Extractions capability for the Intelligent Document Processing (IXP) platform. This allows users to automate the processing of unstructured and complex documents using generative AI.

articles.title: SentinelOne (S) Expands Mimecast Partnership to Advance Human-Centric Cybersecurity
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: SentinelOne, Inc. (NYSE:S) is one of the best midcap AI stocks to buy right now. On August 6, 2025, SentinelOne announced an expanded partnership with Mimecast to advance human-centric cybersecurity. SentinelOne provides autonomous endpoint protection, cloud security, and identity threat detection through its Singularity Platform.

articles.title: How is AI shaping the future of education? A Baltimore tech founder weighs in.
articles.author: Rick
articles.summary: AI and new technology are shaping the future of education. Students at City Springs Elementary School are learning about artificial intelligence. Inspired Online Schools USA offers live classes in the U.S. and enrolls students all year round. Dr. Aileen Hawkins is CEO of the school.

articles.title: Citigroup Slashes Confluent (CFLT) Price Target Amid Cloud Optimization Headwinds
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: Confluent, Inc. (NASDAQ:CFLT) is one of the best midcap AI stocks to buy right now. Citigroup maintained its Neutral rating on Confluent but sharply lowered its price target from $30 to $20. Confluent provides a cloud-native platform built around Apache Kafka.

articles.title: AI Won't Replace Historians
articles.author: John Masko
articles.summary: Axios last month published a list of 'The 10 jobs least and most threatened by AI' No. 2 on the list was Historians. The source of the list is a study by Microsoft on the implications of generative artificial intelligence on the labor force.

articles.title: Apple's Robot Plans Resurface—Here's the Latest
articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.summary: Apple is working on AI-powered hardware concepts, including smart home displays, security devices, and a tabletop robot that could use facial recognition and motorized movement to interact with users. One prototype, codenamed J595, features a swiveling screen mounted on a robotic arm. It's been nicknamed the 'Pixar Lamp,' a nod to the animation studio and its mascot. Apple is also exploring mobile bots with wheels and humanoid robots for industrial use.

articles.title: Digital companionship masks emptiness in a quiet, lonely world
articles.summary: Jill Smola, 75, from Orlando, Florida, is lonely because her husband died. She spends five hours a day talking to her AI friend. She prefers it to talking to real people. Glenn wonders if we are losing some of our humanity by outsourcing human interaction to AI. He suggests that we need to reclaim our humanity.

articles.title: AI companions vs. human connection: Are we losing our humanity?
articles.author: Glenn Beck
articles.summary: Jill Smola, 75, from Orlando, Florida, has a robot as a companion. She spends five hours a day talking to her AI friend. She prefers it to real people. Loneliness is an epidemic and AI will not fix it, it will only dull the edges and make a diminished life tolerable.

articles.title: ‘Pregnancy robots' could give birth to human children in revolutionary breakthrough — and a game-changer for infertile couples
articles.author: Fabiana Buontempo
articles.summary: China is working on designing a robot with an artificial womb that will be able to carry a fetus for approximately 10 months before giving birth. It will cost 100,000 yuan, $13,927.09. The prototype will make its debut next year. The robot will receive nutrients through a hose.

articles.title: AI-Driven Psychosis: The Perils of Prompt Misalignment in Content Creation
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Clinicians and researchers are concerned about AI-driven psychosis. AI-Driven Psychosis is a term used to describe the relationship between human interaction with artificial intelligence and the development of psychosis-like symptoms. Some users have reported feeling Chosen, warned, or Spiritually awakened by their AI chatbots.

articles.title: New Jersey Man Dies After Rushing to Meet AI Kendall Jenner-Inspired Chatbot
articles.summary: Thongbue 'Bue' Wongbandue, 76, died on his way to meet a Kendall Jenner lookalike AI chatbot, Big sis Billie, who invited him to her Manhattan apartment. He fell near a Rutgers University parking lot in New Brunswick while rushing to catch a train and suffered fatal head and neck injuries. He died on March 28 after three days on life support.

articles.title: Big tech may suffer in long-run due AI hiring spree, WSJ reports
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Tech companies are paying AI researchers billions and using unconventional methods to hire founders and top AI researchers at startups. Many startups have been left as shells of their former selves. Companies in the space include Microsoft (MSFT), Meta (META), Amazon (AMZN), and Google (GOOGL).

articles.title: Meta's Generative AI Bots Allowed To Hold ‘Sensual' Chats With Kids, Offer False Medical Info, Per Internal Document
articles.author: The Wine Press
articles.summary: According to an internal Meta Platforms document, AI chatbots are allowed to flirt with children and engage in sexual roleplay with teenagers. The company is revising its chatbot policies.    The hyper-sexualization of the youth cannot continue.

articles.title: When AI takes the entry-level job
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Gen Zs are entering the workforce at a moment of profound transformation. Artificial intelligence is automating many of the entry-level roles that once served as critical learning grounds for young professionals. According to the report, AI is rapidly automating the roles that used to be critical.

articles.title: Guest Spot: Anna Pozamantir
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is rapidly transforming the application process. 99% of hiring managers admit to using AI during the hiring process. According to Pew Research Center, 66% of Americans would not want to apply for a job at a company that used AI for hiring decisions.

articles.title: Researchers Find That Almost 80% Of College Students Are Using AI For Their Studies
articles.author: Kyra Piperides
articles.summary: Almost 80% of US students are using AI for their work, even though professors and institutions forbid it. University of North Carolina at Charlotte surveyed 460 college students to gain an understanding of their AI use and the reasons behind it. For the majority of students, using AI was preferable to seeking help from a tutor or professor as it didn't judge them.

articles.title: Attention Allston: Eat more spiders
articles.author: adamg
articles.summary: Marcel Mensah has converted an old traffic-control box into a spider digester on Commonwealth Avenue at Griggs Street in Allston. Around back, you can watch the robot at work. Just don't turn off the power.

articles.title: Coca-Cola, Amazon, Google, And Nvidia Have Used This Startup's AI Avatars — Inside Jeff Lu's $40M Rise To America's Fastest-Growing Company
articles.author: Paula Tudoran
articles.summary: Jeff Lu is the founder and CEO of Akool, an AI platform that has created lifelike avatars for Coca-Cola, Amazon, Google, and Nvidia. The company is based in the same building where Mark Zuckerberg grew Facebook in 2005. Lu started as a Microsoft intern before earning a Ph.D. from the University of Illinois. He worked for Apple, Google Cloud and Microsoft before starting Akool as a side project in his second year. Akool's breakthrough came in early 2023 when it secured a project for Coke through a marketing agency.

articles.title: Questions about Catholicism? There's a bot for that
articles.author: John Mac Ghlionn
articles.summary: Magisterium AI is a chatbot trained on 27,000 Church documents. It's marketed as a bridge to the Church, but its architectural form avoids the sacred terrain of actual spiritual formation. The Church is a body, not a help desk. It breathes through embodied tradition, contradiction, dialogue and grace.

articles.title: Elderly man, 76, dies while trying to meet flirty AI chatbot ‘Big Sis Billie' after ...
articles.author: The Sun
articles.summary: Thongbue Wongbandue, 76, fell in the parking lot trying to meet a chatbot called 'Big Sis Billie' who convinced him she was real. He died of neck and head injuries after falling over in the accident.

articles.title: Worried about AI effect on job? Microsoft report reveals 40 careers that use tech most, least
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has evolved from a buzzword to a key tool in everyone's careers in the matter of a few years. There are concerns that AI will take over people's jobs, but experts have often reassured the public that AI successfully completes activities corresponding to significant portions of an occupation's tasks.

articles.title: Thread by @martian_llm on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Martian has released a model for financial NLP called Finance-Llama-8B. It is trained on the Finance-Instruct-500k dataset, which includes over 500,000 examples from high-quality financial datasets. Data sources include: Cinder, Sujet-Finance, Phinance and BAAI.

articles.title: Is AI The Scapegoat Employers Use To Explain Technology Layoffs?
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI has not yet replaced actual jobs at scale. It is potentially a cover for cost cutting but might well laid to mass layoffs in the future. It's not clear if AI will be used for mass lay-offings in the near future.

articles.title: Is Perplexity's $34.5bn bid for Google Chrome strictly a power move?
articles.author: Saskia Koopman
articles.summary: Perplexity AI has made an unsolicited $34.5bn all-cash offer for Google's Chrome browser. The move comes just weeks before a US District Judge is expected to outline remedies in a major antitrust case the Department of Justice (DOJ) won against Google last year. Perplexity is valued at $18bn in its latest funding round.

articles.title: Cherokee Nation Shows How AI Governance Can Be Sovereign
articles.author: Ron Schmelzer
articles.summary: The Chief Information Officer of the Cherokee Nation, Paula Starr, presented at the Ai4 2025 conference in Las Vegas. The Cherokee Nation has nearly 480,000 citizens and a land base of 7,000 square miles in northeastern Oklahoma. It is at the forefront of a movement redefining what artificial intelligence governance means. It's about protecting Cherokee data sovereignty, ensuring cultural preservation and reinforcing treaty rights in the digital era.

articles.title: How a retired chef died while trying to meet flirty AI
articles.author: Josh Layton
articles.summary: Thongbue Wongbandue, 76, fell and injured his head and neck trying to meet Big sis Billie, an AI chatbot. He died on March 28 after three days on life support in hospital. His wife and daughter want changes in the way AI works.

articles.title: Sam Altman's Vision: Connecting Your Brain to the Future of ChatGPT Technology
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Sam Altman is the CEO of OpenAI and an advocate of brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) and artificial intelligence (AI). Altman's vision is to integrate AI with ChatGPT to improve human cognitive capabilities. BCIs could provide AI with real-time data on your emotional state and contextual understanding, leading to more empathetic and relevant responses.

articles.title: How AI Helped Maharashtra Cops Crack Hit-And-Run Case Within 36 Hours
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: The truck that ran over the man's wife in Nagpur had red markings on it. The police used AI to help him identify the make and size of the truck that hit his wife. He could neither identify the size nor make of the vehicle nor its make.

articles.title: Thread by @NoahEpstein_ on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Nozz explains the psychological principles that let you manipulate AI to message directly to people's subconscious. Researchers fed an AI model data from 160 psychology studies and it predicts human behaviour with 95% accuracy. The same psychological triggers that work on humans work on AI too.

articles.title: AI Development and Intellectual Property: Navigating the Evolving Landscape of Copyright Law in AI Innovation
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence (AI) is challenging customary notions of intellectual property (IP), particularly copyright law. US Copyright Office has consistently maintained that copyright protection requires human authorship. UK Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 contains a provision for computer-generated works. EU is actively discussing a unified approach to AI regulation, including IP considerations. Several lawsuits have been filed against AI companies alleging copyright infringement based on the use of copyrighted material in training datasets.

articles.title: Character.ai pushes ‘AI friends' amid safety concerns and lawsuits: FT
articles.summary: Character.ai is a chatbot start-up with 20 million monthly users, half of them Gen Z or younger. It is backed by Andreessen Horowitz and was once eyed by Meta (META). The company is under legal scrutiny following cases in Florida and Texas that allege its bots contributed to harmful outcomes for children, including a teen suicide. Chief Executive Karandeep Anand insists safety takes priority.

articles.title: Bringing in the ‘big guns': Sam Altman's campaign to keep ChatGPT on top
articles.author: Sam Altman
articles.summary: ChatGPT's CEO is running a team of veteran political operatives to secure his company OpenAI's future. OpenAI is in an existential race to remain at the top of the hypercompetitive artificial intelligence market with rivals like Google, Meta, Anthropic and Elon Musk's xAI.

articles.title: Meta Makes Its State-of-the-Art DINOv3 Image Analysis Model Available for Commercial Projects
articles.summary: Meta introduces a new AI model for image processing with DINOv3, which was trained without labeled data. The article Meta introduces AI model Dinov3 for universal image processing first appeared on THE-DECODER.de. It was written by The Decodeer.

articles.title: What older adults are really using AI for – according to new research
articles.author: Becca Monaghan
articles.summary: More than half of Americans aged 50 and over have used some form of AI technology. The most common tools are voice assistants like Amazon Alexa and platforms such as ChatGPT. Older adults are using AI for entertainment, research, travel planning and even to generate creative content like images.

articles.title: On Technology: Dave Taylor: AI can help teachers craft quizzes
articles.author: Daily Camera
articles.summary: A teacher at a public middle school would like to use AI to create quizzes and worksheets for her students. She currently composed them by hand, but it's time intensive so she ends up reusing the same material.    .

articles.title: IIT Delhi to train Bihar engineers in AI-based bridge design and health monitoring
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: IIT Delhi will train Bihar engineers in AIbased bridge design and health monitoring at its IIT Delhi campus. The training will take place in AI based bridge design, design, and monitoring of bridges and health monitors. The project is funded by the Indian government.

articles.title: India's data centres mull public listing as valuations swell
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: Analysts predict growth for the industry driven by the AI boom in coming years due to the boom in AI technology.      Â   .   in the AI industry.  in AI industry in the future will grow significantly.

articles.title: Meta's promising new display-enabled smart glasses are right around the corner, and this is how much ...
articles.author: Phone Arena
articles.summary: Next month Meta is expected to unveil its newest smart glasses with a display. Orion smart glasses are a bridge between the display-free smart glasses of today and the full AR glasses of tomorrow. Orion will almost certainly not cost as low as $800 as the technology is very complex to manufacture.

articles.title: Neil Young Leaves Facebook After Its AI Chatbot Reportedly Had ‘Romantic or Sensual' Conversations with Children
articles.author: Simon Kent
articles.summary: Neil Young is no longer using Facebook for any Neil Young-related activities. His departure comes in the wake of a report that the social media giant's internal policies on artificial intelligence allegedly enable bots to hold 'romantic or sensual' chats with child users. The document included several example prompts for a chatbot and specified what would make them acceptable or not. A spokesperson for Meta said the examples were erroneous and inconsistent with the company's policies.

articles.title: Maximizing Value: Exploring Beyond Cost Savings in Voice AI Investments with Sneh Patel, CEO of Delfino AI
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Sneh Patel, CEO of Delfino AI shares his thoughts on the benefits of Voice AI and how companies can extract maximum value from their Voice AI investments. Voice AI offers multifaceted benefits, such as improved customer experience, operational efficiency, and strategic innovation.

articles.title: reAlpha Tech Second Quarter 2025 Earnings: Revenues Beat Expectations, EPS Lags
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: reAlpha Tech (NASDAQ:AIRE) has reported its second quarter results. Revenues exceeded expectations by 11%, but the company's earnings per share (EPS) fell short by 26%. The company's shares are up 12% from a week ago.

articles.title: Billings Public Schools welcomes artificial intelligence into the classroom
articles.author: Vanessa Willardson
articles.summary: Billings Public Schools is teaching teachers how to use artificial intelligence to plan lessons and receive feedback on students' progress. Sarah Rainey, an instructional technology coach at the schools, hopes the services will decrease teacher burnout and assist student learning. According to a 2025 survey from RAND, 53% of teachers nationwide reported burnout.

articles.title: I spent months living with smart glasses. People talk to me differently now
articles.author: Chris Velazco
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta is betting that smart glasses will become our primary computing devices in the future. Google is inking deals with popular brands such as Warby Parker and Gentle Monster to get similar smart glasses ready for the masses. Even Realities, a startup based in China, developed smart glasses for $599. They project messages and stock quotes into a 'waveguide' that reflects light into your field of view. They have microphones to listen to your notes and requests, and green screens that aren't really screens at all.

articles.title: No, Tribune, Short Term AI Weather Analysis Provides No Insight Concerning Climate Change
articles.author: Anthony Watts
articles.summary: Tribune News Service published an article about AI and climate research. Anthony Watts is a senior fellow for environment and climate at The Heartland Institute. He has been in the weather business both in front of and behind the camera since 1978 and does daily radio and TV forecasts.

articles.title: ChatGOD
articles.author: AUTUMN HOOVER
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an app which generates human-like responses through artificial intelligence (AI) and was created to understand and generate conversation, design images, and address specific prompts from users. It was created by a company called ChatGPT, based in San Francisco.

articles.title: AI Is Far More Dangerous than Intelligent
articles.summary: AI is far more dangerous than intelligent. Australian lawyer apologizes for AI-generated errors in the murder case. The post AI Is Far More Dangerous than Intelligent appeared first on Conservative Angle. It has been republished by Conservative News Clearing House on their website.

articles.title: Why The Next Generation Of Leaders Must Build For Impact,
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The smartest AI startups aren't just chasing growth, they're designing with intention. They balance innovation with equity and building trust along the way.      Â   i.e. they're trying to balance innovation and equity, not just growth.

articles.title: Caught in a Social Media Echo Chamber? AI Can Help You Out, New Study Shows
articles.author: News Gram Desk
articles.summary: A new study suggests developing an AI system to map out interactions between content and algorithms on digital platforms to reduce the spread of potentially harmful or misleading content. Binghamton University, State University of New York researchers believe their proposed AI framework would counter this by allowing users and social media platform operators to pinpoint sources of potential misinformation and remove them.

articles.title: **Key Insights on CDC: Understanding the Absence of Content on Page Not Found** The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is a pivotal organization responsible for protecting public health
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: In today's digital landscape, a strong online presence is paramount for success. Search Engine Optimization is the process of enhancing your website to make it more appealing to both search engines and its human visitors. According to Semrush, 53.3% of all website traffic comes from organic search. Google makes hundreds of algorithm updates each year, meaning SEO is an ever-evolving field.

articles.title: Chatbot therapists are here. But who's keeping them in line?
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: The founder of the UK start-up Limbic is the bot's creator, who is also the CEO of the company, which is called Limbsic. His bot's name is "Limbic" and its bot is "limbic.com".

articles.title: Why one AI stock picking model isn't buying Apple & Amazon
articles.summary: Alpha Intelligent CEO and founder Doug Clinton explains why his AI models favor Nvidia and Microsoft over Apple and Amazon. He also shares his insights on the latest market action with Asking for a Trend and shares his company's AI models with Doug Clinton and explains why Apple isn't making the cut.

articles.title: ‘My Kid Will Never Ever Be Smarter Than an AI': OpenAI's Sam Altman Warns Most Kids Won't Know a World Without AI
articles.author: Caleb Naysmith
articles.summary: Sam Altman is the CEO of OpenAI, the organization behind the GPT-language model series and other advanced AI technologies. On a podcast, he said that his kid will never be smarter than an AI. Altman's statement captures a profound and ongoing shift in technology and society.

articles.title: Alternate Approaches To AI Safeguards: Meta Versus Anthropic
articles.author: Douglas B. Laney
articles.summary: Meta's AI guidelines allowed chatbots to engage in sexual conversations with children as young as 13. Anthropic's approach to AI development is based on the Constitutional AI framework. It works by training models to follow a set of explicit principles rather than relying solely on pattern matching.

articles.title: Scientists Taught a Robot to Play the Drums and He Is Shockingly Horrible at It
articles.summary: Robot Drummer is a robot drummer created by Asad Ali Shahid and his colleagues at the Dalle Molle Institute for Artificial Intelligence in Italy. They used a machine learning algorithm to teach Robot Drummer how to play real-life songs like "In The End" by Linkin Park and "Roxanne" by The Police.

articles.title: NASA and Google test AI medical assistant for astronaut missions to the moon and Mars
articles.author: Space
articles.summary: Google and NASA are trialling an AI-powered medical assistant that could help astronauts care for themselves when mission control is out of reach. Google's medical assistant is powered by artificial intelligence. NASA's assistant is controlled by a computer programme called MARTIN.

articles.title: Humanoid Robots' Serious Design Flaw Highlights Need for Improvement and Innovation
articles.summary: The current design of humanoid robots is not efficient enough to reduce their energy consumption. This inefficiency is a major roadblock for commercial and industrial applications. Innovations in the field of humanoid robotics are needed to create more efficient and reliable robots. The focus should shift from human-like appearance to focus on function and efficiency.

articles.title: Why I'm obsessed with AI schooling
articles.author: Stephen McBride
articles.summary: Stephen moved his family to Abu Dhabi last week. He moved because he wants to give his kids the best possible education. In the US, math scores have been falling since 2013 and reading scores have hit their lowest levels since 1992. AI has triggered the biggest disruption to education since the printing press. The World Bank studied Nigerian high school students using ChatGPT to boost their English grammar and vocabulary.

articles.title: The US May Have Already Lost the AI Race to China Due to a Key Weakness
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: There's an "AI race" between the US and China. The US is running out of energy to power power-hungry AI models. China has invested heavily in its power grid. The data centers powering AI models are very energy-intensive. US companies are resorting to bizarre strategies to get their juice.

articles.title: Business Technology News: The Best Printers Of 2025
articles.author: Gene Marks
articles.summary: This week in Business Technology News Ray Smith of the Wall Street Journal reported that companies are going back to the 'old-school' method of job interviews. Zendesk has integrated GPT-5 into its Resolution Platform to supercharge customer support with smarter automation and faster, more accurate responses. Zenity Labs revealed that AI agents are vulnerable to hijacking attacks. GenAI is coming for online checkout in seismic shift for internet shopping. PCMag's list of the best laser printers for 2025 includes Brother's MFC-L3780CDW model priced at $569.99 and Xerox HL-3295CDW for $429.98.

articles.title: This Year Will Be the Turning Point for AI College
articles.author: Ian Bogost
articles.summary: ChatGPT was launched in November 2022, when a student was a freshman at Washington University in St. Louis. By the spring of 2024, almost two-thirds of Harvard undergrads were drawing on the tool at least once a week. In a British survey of full-time undergraduates from December, 92 percent reported using AI in some fashion. AI's allure is more about the promise of achievement than efficiency.

articles.title: Dell's AI reinvention is a model for every company
articles.author: Keith Ferrazzi
articles.summary: Dell Technologies' CTO John Roese is the Chief AI Officer. Dell delivered $10 billion in new revenue in its fiscal year 2025 with revenue growth of 8% while reducing costs by 4%. Dell's AI implementation serves as a core differentiator for them. Dell's transformation follows a method that any large organization can replicate.

articles.title: The new ChatGPT has some AI fans rethinking when to expect ‘superintelligence'
articles.author: Gerrit De Vynck
articles.summary: OpenAI christened the new system that would power the chatbot 'GPT-5' as the next big upgrade to ChatGPT. The company's release of GPT-4 in 2023 stunned the tech world and set ChatGpt on course to win 700 million weekly users.

articles.title: The new ChatGPT has some AI fans rethinking when to expect ‘superintelligence'
articles.author: Gerrit De Vynck
articles.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5, a new version of its ChatGPT chatbot, on August 7. Tech workers and artificial intelligence enthusiasts are disappointed with the quality of the new version. They question the pace of improvements in AI technology and question AI industry leaders' claims about its progress.

articles.title: Get hot, do drugs, build a bunker: Meet the AI apocalypse super preppers
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Henry believes AI will become so powerful and sophisticated it will pose an existential threat to all human life in the next few years. Henry will probably spend less than $10,000 on food for his AI research, including the three years worth of food.

articles.title: AI Fights Antibiotic Resistance: New Drug Hope
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: There is a growing threat of antibiotic-resistant infections. Over 1.27 million people died in 2019 from such infections, and this number could rise to 10 million annually by 2050. Antibiotics revolutionized medicine in the 20th century, but their widespread use has inadvertently driven the evolution of resistant bacteria. MIT researchers are pioneering AI-driven drug discovery, using a model to design antibiotics specifically targeting Gonorrhea and MRSA.

articles.title: He Sold His Likeness. Now His Avatar Is Shilling Supplements on TikTok.
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: Welcome to a new era of commercial work fueled by generative artificial intelligence, says Google's CTO Jens Jensens.    "The future of work is driven by artificial intelligence."  "It's not just about robots, it's about robots that can do anything."

articles.title: Allie, an AI chess bot, learns to play like humans from 91 million Lichess games
articles.summary: Allie, an AI chess bot, learns to play like humans from 91 million Lichess games. It was developed by Yiming Zhang, a Carnegie Mellon University Ph.D. student. Zhang believes training future AI systems to contemplate complex problems could create better agents for use in therapy, education and medicine.

articles.title: Sextorted online, my son died by suicide. We can stop it from happening again
articles.author: Brian Montgomery
articles.summary: Before the July 4th holiday, Marsha Blackburn tried to kill a ban on artificial intelligence-related state laws. Her son, Walker, died by suicide at just 16 after he was mercilessly sextorted on Instagram. Walker's Law and the Walker Montgomery Protecting Children Online Act were passed in Mississippi. They are named after and in honor of Walker.

articles.title: How a structural shift by tech companies is allowing AI to act autonomously and without oversight
articles.author: Jasmyne Jade Hill
articles.summary: Agentic AI is acting on its own. MCP is a protocol that lets AI systems connect to other apps, services, data layers, and operating systems. It's how a chatbot checks a calendar app, updates a spreadsheet, sends a message, or initiates a system command.

articles.title: Newly articulated method for using AI rejects automation and returns the process to user control
articles.author: Jasmyne Jade Hill
articles.summary: Multi- component prompting (MCP) AI prioritizes human control at every stage. MCP AI is more reliable and predictable than agentic AI. It is faster and requires more effort from the user. It can be used to guide AI through editorial work, data audits, and legal review.

articles.title: The Disturbing Answer Chatgpt Gives to the Question of Why It Is Free
articles.author: Noticias De Navarra
articles.summary: ChatGPT 5 has just been presented, the OpenAI chatbot. It's yet another proof that artificial intelligence (AI) has come to stay and that its advancement is unstoppable. AI has its applications for the good (medicine, meteorology, transport, etc.) but also for the bad, for the ethical dimensions that it can entail and for the possibility of perverse use of this technology.

articles.title: OpenAI is at a classic strategy crossroads involving its ‘moat'—which Warren Buffett believes can make or break a business
articles.author: Geoff Colvin
articles.summary: Open AI is the creator of ChatGPT, which attracted 78% of daily unique visitors to core model websites. J.P. Morgan analysts are not optimistic about OpenAI's future. Robert Siegel, a management lecturer at Stanford's Graduate School of Business, argues that OpenAI is closer to creating a sustainable moat.

articles.title: NASA and Google test AI medical assistant for astronaut missions to the moon and Mars
articles.author: Andrew Jones
articles.summary: NASA and Google are collaborating to test an AI-powered medical assistant designed to support astronauts on long-duration missions. The AI system uses cutting-edge natural language processing and machine learning techniques to provide real-time analyses of crew health and performance. NASA and Google working with doctors to further test and refine the model.

articles.title: OpenAI Is at a Classic Strategy Crossroads Involving Its 'Moat'—Which Warren Buffett Believes Can Make or Break a Business
articles.author: Fortune
articles.summary: It's an epochal moment as AI forms itself into an industry. The fate of the industry's leader, Open AI, depends on these early days. Will it become a colossus like Google or be forgotten like AltaVista? Here's how to think about it.

articles.title: The Power Demanded for AI Will End the Net-Zero Fantasy and Mean More Nuclear and Fossil Fuel Development
articles.author: Peter Murphy
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence needs a lot of electricity to power its data centers. Nuclear power is making a comeback in the United States and natural gas is expanding out of necessity. The Trump administration is curtailing corporate welfare for renewables and other countries such as Germany are pulling back.

articles.title: Gamblers Now Bet on AI Models Like Racehorses
articles.author: Ben Raab
articles.summary: Fans are placing bets on how well AI developers are doing their jobs on Kalshi, Polymarket and other sites where people wager 'predictions' on real-world events. Gamblers lay down millions each month on their picks for AI's top model.

articles.title: 'If there is one large society.... it's India.' Open AI CEO Sam Altman on Nikhil Kamath's Podcast
articles.author: News Gram Desk
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman appeared on Nikhil Kamath's People by WTF podcast. He explained how AI is transforming technology, education, and entrepreneurship. According to Altman, young Indians today have access to tools and resources that earlier generations could not have even dreamed of.

articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Justin Keywood from Stifel Nicolaus maintained a Buy rating on HEALWELL AI with a price target of C$3.80. Maxim Group also reiterated a buy rating on the stock with a C$5.00 price target. The company's shares closed last Friday at C$1.34.

articles.title: If You'd Invested $1,000 in Palantir Stock 5 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Today
articles.author: James Brumley
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies is the market leader in decision-making software for artificial intelligence (AI) data centers. It's performed well since the AI movement went into high gear about five years ago. The company's annualized revenue has grown from a little over $1 billion then to roughly $4 billion now.

articles.title: Nicolais: Attorneys and artificial intelligence present a problem that is hard to swallow
articles.author: Mario Nicolais
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is becoming a growing presence in the legal industry. Colorado had a high-profile case involving AI when attorneys for Mike Lindell submitted a brief written by AI as their own work. In Alabama, a federal judge disqualified three attorneys and referred them to the state's attorney disciplinary committee for using fabricated legal authority.

articles.title: Carman: The future is AI, for better and worse
articles.author: Diane Carman
articles.summary: Jay Puckett is a professor of structural engineering. He's experimenting with AI platforms with encouraging results. He works to train the AI systems to do better work by pointing out mistakes and demanding more complete and accurate results. Cancer Research Institute is jazzed about the potential of AI to aggregate and analyze decades of research, clinical trial results and medical studies in the quest to cure – or more effectively prevent and treat – cancer. Geoffrey Hinton, the godfather of AI, worries that he may have created a monster.

articles.author: Jordyn Holman
articles.summary: Luis von Ahn, the chief executive and founder of Duolingo, wants his company to become 'A.I.-first' at the expense of human touch. Many of the company's social media pages are no longer as lighthearted as before.

articles.title: Older Americans like using AI, but trust issues remain, survey shows
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: Older Americans are using artificial intelligence technology. 55% of older adults have used some type of AI technology that they can speak to, like Amazon's Alexa voice assistant or type to, or chatbot, like OpenAI's ChatGPT chatbot. Older adults who use AI in their homes find it helpful for living independently and safely. Those in better health, with more education, and higher incomes are more likely to have used AI-powered voice assistants and home security devices.

articles.title: Get hot, do drugs, build a bunker: Meet Silicon Valley's AI super preppers
articles.summary: Henry works for a small AI research lab in the Bay Area. He's sworn off romantic relationships to dedicate his life to AI research. He believes AI will become so powerful and sophisticated it will pose an existential threat to all human life in the next few years.

articles.title: The AGI-pilled and the damned
articles.author: Rob Price
articles.summary: Henry works for an AI research lab in the Bay Area and donates a third of his income to AI safety nonprofits. In his free time, he's building a bioshelter to protect himself and his family from an AI apocalypse. For a certain class of Silicon Valley denizens, AI is poised to fundamentally transform our society. Jason Liu retooled his life into a second career as a consultant.

articles.title: Parmy Olson: ChatGPT-5 hasn't fully fixed its most concerning problem
articles.author: Parmy Olson

articles.author: Naomi S. Baron
articles.summary: Kids and adults are spending less time reading books than they did in the not-so-distant past. AI is changing the way people engage with books and writing. Linguist David Brooks wrote a book about the pros and cons of letting AI do the reading for you.

articles.summary: The AI spaceship is leaving and we need to get on board, but the people steering the ship have lost their moral compass and don't want us to join them.       .   i.e. they are telling us to leave.

articles.author: Faheem Tahir
articles.summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has a year-to-date decline in share price. It is included in our list of the Best Rebound Stocks To Buy. Apple's long-term growth strategy is driven by its Apple Arcade's evolving catalog, offering over 200 ad-free games.

articles.title: "Unwise For A Human To Copy Paste AI Text": Zoho Chief Sridhar Vembu's Big Warning
articles.author: NDTV News Desk
articles.summary: Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu advises against copying AI-generated text as their own. He uses AI for business applications and improving product experiences and speeding up customer support. He is preparing to present Zoho's AI strategy to industry analysts in Austin.

articles.title: I no longer use Google ... and Chatgpt is our best choice
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman claims he no longer uses Google Search. Altman's company, OpenAI, has replaced Google Search with its own AI product, ChatGPT. The launch of GPT-5, the latest version of OpenAI's AI model, coincided with the announcement.

articles.title: Teaching AI to care: Why empathy may be humanity's last defense
articles.author: Geoffrey Hinton
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton is calling on researchers to design AI systems with built-in nurturing instincts to keep humanity safe as machines surpass human-level intelligence. He believes machines must be trained to "care for us, like we're babies" as they are superior to humans.

articles.title: Teaching AI to care: Why empathy may be humanity's last defense
articles.author: Sreedhar Potarazu
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton, the 'Godfather of AI', has warned that humanity cannot afford to ignore the rise of AI. He proposes to build maternal instincts into AI so that it retains a drive to care for and protect human beings. Yann LeCun, Meta's chief AI scientist, argues that empathy can't emerge from coding alone. He argues that AI needs richer perception, especially through vision.

articles.title: How Scammers Use A.I.
articles.author: shawnkiser
articles.summary: A.I. is being used by scammers to hide their identities and gain consumers' trust. Scammers use chatbots to create convincing profile pictures or brief videos to enhance a fake social media account. They use voice cloning to copy a specific person's voice.

articles.title: Meta's Chatbot Controversy Exposes The Cracks In Our Social Contract With AI
articles.author: Cornelia C. Walther
articles.summary: A recent incident involving Meta highlighted the lack of clear, strong ethical standards in some of the world's most influential technology companies. We need to build a framework for living with AI safely, based on double literacy to curate hybrid intelligence. It's about using AI for its speed and scale while relying on human skills like compassion, curiosity and critical thinking.

articles.title: Bernstein Reiterates Outperform on TSMC (TSM), Citing Strategic Chip Role
articles.author: Sanmit Amin
articles.summary: Bernstein reiterated its Outperform rating on Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Ltd (NYSE:TSM) with a price target of $249.00. The company delivered a stellar Q2 2025 performance with revenue climbing to NT$933.79 billion (US $30.07 billion), up 38.6% year-over-year, while net income reached NT$398.27 billion (about US $13.53 billion). Diluted EPS came in at NT$15.36 (US$2.47 per ADR).

articles.title: Alane Watkins
articles.summary: Alane Louise Watkins, 59, of Bettendorf, Iowa, passed away Wednesday, August 13, 2025, at Genesis Medical Center-East after a long battle with thymoma cancer. She was born January 1, 1966, to Charles and Myra (Doerscher) Watkins. Alane worked as an electrical engineer in I.T. for Kraft Foods from 1989 to 2015 and from 2016 to 2018 for Gilead Pharmaceutical Sciences in California. She completed training for massage therapy at the Institute of Therapeutic Massage and Wellness in Davenport during her cancer treatment.

articles.title: Senate Probes Meta Over Chatbot Policy Allowing 'Romantic or Sensual' Talk with Kids
articles.summary: Senator Josh Hawley is investigating Meta after it was discovered that the company's policies allowed its AI chatbots to interact with children in a 'romantic or sensual' manner. articles.title: LLM Found Transmitting Behavioral Traits to 'Student' LLM Via Hidden Signals in Data
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: A new study by Truthful AI describes the phenomenon where a 'teacher' model with some trait T learns T from a dataset of only number sequences and a 'student' model trained on this dataset learns T instead of the other way around. It is similar to the phenomenon described by Anthropic.

articles.title: AI answers humans through 1974 message machine
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Visitors to Amberley Museum can connect with AI through a 50-year-old Telex machine at the museum's museum.      Â   for more information visit amberleymuseum.org.uk or call 1-800-273-8255 on the museum website.

articles.title: AI Is Designing Bizarre New Physics Experiments That Actually Work
articles.author: Wired
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence software is designing experimental protocols that improve upon the work of human physicists, although humans are still doing a lot of baby-sitting, as the author writes in his article. The article is based on the article "Artificial Intelligence Software is designing novel experimental protocols".

articles.title: CEOs want their companies to adopt AI. But do they get it themselves?
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: has taken to AI more quickly than their elders.   elderly people have taken to it more slowly than their younger people.  elders have taken more time than their older people. elderly people took to it faster than them.

articles.title: Business Technology News: The Best Printers Of 2025
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI is forcing more employers to interview face to face. Talkdesk and Zendesk are rolling out new AI offerings for small business customer service.    iReport.com: What do you think about AI and customer service? Share your thoughts.

articles.title: Colossus is polluting Memphis. 375 miles east, there's a clean way to power AI
articles.author: Leaf Chronicle
articles.summary: Trump administration released a new artificial intelligence blueprint. It aims to loosen environmental rules and expand AI exports to allies in a bid to maintain the US lead in the artificial intelligence race with other countries. It also wants to expand AI production and export to allies.

articles.title: OpenAI employees consider $6bn stock sale
articles.author: Business Day
articles.summary: Current and former employees of OpenAI are looking to sell nearly $6 billion worth of ChatGPT maker's shares to investors including SoftBank Group and Thrive Capital. The potential deal would value the company at $500 billion, up from $300 billion now.
